Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2018 06:24AM Dena_01 wrote: Good morning all - It has been a while since I have posted and I am back in the system again. Pretty much the same spot as before. Update on the surgical consult form 1.5 years ago: I went to a well known specialist and he believed it was pretty much up to me to have the distortion removed due to discordant results. Either that or short term follow-up. Since I am not much of a worrier by nature and to be honest was quite tired of all of the incongruent medical advice/results, I chose to take a break. Fast forward to now, I had my 3D mammo and follow up US yesterday and they took quite some time to come back to me with results (which I am so grateful I get results the same day from a dr.) (Before it was 11mm) They got the team together since my case is "complicated" and best decided that another MRI was necessary to see if the nodule that shows only on MRI has grown as well. My question is (which I didn't ask yesterday because it has been a while since I have researched this a nd forgot about it) - has anyone had a circumstance regarding distortion changes after biopsy? I have read quite a bit that distortion can be caused by previous biopsies. But then I read that the distortion heals or decreases over time. It has been 1.5 years and is larger. It is all very, very confusing. suzythatisme and anamia3-me - Any updates on your end??? I know it has been a while..

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2016 06:26AM Dena_01 wrote: I am so thankful I have found this thread! Hate the circumstances but hey, what are you gonna do? I just wanted to post and say I am in the same exact boat. several mammo/us/ mri/stereobx all for 11mm stellate distortion. MRI shows enhancing nodule in same location (although I just realized I have no info on the margins, shape, kinetics on that. Duh) Nothing shows on US (not the distortion or the nodule). Path reports of distortion benign- normal breast tissue. Radiologist team doesn't agree. Recommends surgical excision. Seems kinda extreme to me to remove something that hasn't been confirmed so I am going to get another opinion on the images while I wait for a surgical consult on 3/25. Hoping everyone had the same benign results. :)
